lines.text: What do you think about the kids?

From what I've heard from the outside sources for many years I was very, very much surprised and I'm very happy to say we think the people of this country should be proud of these kids, not withstanding the way they dress or the way they wear their hair, that's their own personal business; but their, their inner workings, their inner selves, their, their self-demeanour cannot be questioned; they can't be questioned as good American citizens.
That's kind of surprising coming from a cop.

[smiling]
I'm not a cop, I'm the Chief of Police.
that a half a million kids can get together and have three days of fun and music and have nothing *but* fun and music, and I God bless you for it!
This is our second gig.
This is the second time we've ever played in front of people, man, we're scared shitless.
Good morning! What we have in mind is breakfast in bed for four hundred thousand.
We must be in heaven, man!
Gimme an F!
F!
Gimme a U!
U!
Gimme a C!
C!
Gimme a K!
K!
What's that spell?
FUCK!
It's incredible. I heard the New York Thruway's closed.
Closed? This morning we heard that they were backed down Route 17 with an eight hour delay.
Right. Well, the New York Thruway's closed. Isn't that far out?
We have one more tune for you, It's called "Soul Sacrifice !"
There's always a little bit of heaven in a disaster area.

[holding a joint into camera]
Marijuana! Exhibit A.

[beginning his set]
I see that we meet again, hmmm...
Lotta freaks!
